Write a short, informative, and quantitative news story on 'eric dane' with multiple twists and turns by summarizing this article: "Euphoria" is scheduled to begin production on its third and final season.

Eric Dane reveals he's been diagnosed with ALS, says he'll return to 'Euphoria'

Eric Dane attends a screening of "One Fast Move" at Culver Theater on August 06, 2024 in Culver City, California.

Eric Dane attends a screening of "One Fast Move" at Culver Theater on August 06, 2024 in Culver City, California.

Eric Dane attends a screening of "One Fast Move" at Culver Theater on August 06, 2024 in Culver City, California.

Eric Dane attends a screening of "One Fast Move" at Culver Theater on August 06, 2024 in Culver City, California.

Former "Grey's Anatomy" star Eric Dane revealed he has been diagnosed with ALS, also known as Lou Gehrig's disease.

The 52-year-old shared the health update with People, saying, "I have been diagnosed with ALS," and adding, "I am grateful to have my loving family by my side as we navigate this next chapter."

Eric Dane attends a screening of "One Fast Move" at Culver Theater on August 06, 2024 in Culver City, California. Michael Tullberg/Getty Images

ALS, short for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, is a degenerative neurological disorder where the symptoms worsen over time, according to the National Institutes of Health.

The NIH notes that ALS causes motor neurons, a type of nerve cell in the brain and spinal cord to deteriorate, causing the muscles to weaken and eventually leads to paralysis, taking away a person's ability to move, speak or even breathe.

There is currently no known cure for ALS but some treatments, including FDA-approved medications and physical and speech therapies, may slow down the progression of the disorder and improve an ALS patient's quality of life.

Dr. Leah Croll, a neurologist for Maimonides Health, told ABC News that a person's age is considered to be one of the risk factors of ALS.

"Most people will be diagnosed somewhere between the ages of 40 and 70. And typically, the average age of diagnosis is about 55," Croll said. "There's really only two known risk factors for ALS. One is a family history of it and the other is age. So the older you are, the more likely you are to get it."

Dane, who has built a 30-year acting career, shot to fame amid six seasons on the hit ABC drama "Grey's Anatomy," where he played Dr. Mark Sloan, affectionately known as "McSteamy."

More recently, the longtime actor portrayed Cal Jacobs, the head of the Jacobs family, on "Euphoria."

Dane told People that despite his diagnosis, he's continuing to work on the hit HBO show, which begins filming its third and final season on April 14.

"I feel fortunate that I am able to continue working and am looking forward to returning to [the] set of 'Euphoria' next week," Dane said.

But Dane, often in the spotlight, is also requesting space, telling People, "I kindly ask that you give my family and I privacy during this time."

The actor is married to Rebecca Gayheart and the couple share two daughters.

Gayheart had filed for divorce in 2018 but called it off in March 2025.

Eric Dane, best known for his role as "McSteamy" on "Grey's Anatomy" and Cal Jacobs in HBO's "Euphoria," has revealed a deeply personal health challenge. The 52-year-old actor, who has enjoyed a successful 30-year career, announced that he has been diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), a progressive neurological condition. In an interview with *People*, Dane expressed gratitude for his family's support as he begins this difficult journey, stating, "I have been diagnosed with ALS... I am grateful to have my loving family by my side as we navigate this next chapter."

ALS is a degenerative disorder that impacts motor neurons, leading to muscle weakness, paralysis, and often affecting the ability to speak and breathe. The condition predominantly affects individuals between the ages of 40 and 70, with the average diagnosis occurring at around 55 years old.

Despite his diagnosis, Dane remains committed to his work, confirming that he will return to "Euphoria" as filming commences for its third and final season on April 14. "I feel fortunate that I am able to continue working and am looking forward to returning to [the] set of 'Euphoria' next week," he noted.

In a twist, while Dane's career is once again on the rise, his personal life has seen its ups and downs. His wife, Rebecca Gayheart, initially filed for divorce in 2018 but reconciled in March 2025, and they now share two daughters. As Dane navigates both his health challenges and professional commitments, he has requested privacy for his family during this trying time.

As he faces his diagnosis head-on, fans and fellow actors alike continue to support Dane, underscoring the resilience often found in the entertainment community.

**Eric Dane Faces ALS Diagnosis as Production for "Euphoria" Resumes**

Eric Dane, the beloved actor recognized for his roles in "Grey's Anatomy" and "Euphoria," has revealed that he has been diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), a progressive neurological disease. The 52-year-old shared this news with *People*, expressing gratitude for the support of his family during this challenging time. "I have been diagnosed with ALS," he said, adding, "I am grateful to have my loving family by my side as we navigate this next chapter."

ALS, famously known as Lou Gehrig's disease, causes the deterioration of motor neurons, progressively leading to muscle weakness, paralysis, and the eventual loss of the ability to move, speak, or breathe. According to the National Institutes of Health (NIH), there is currently no cure for ALS, although certain FDA-approved treatments may slow its progression. The average age of diagnosis is around 55, with most cases occurring between 40 and 70 years of age. 

In an encouraging twist, despite his diagnosis, Dane announced that he will continue to work on "Euphoria," which is set to begin filming its third and final season on April 14. "I feel fortunate that I am able to continue working and am looking forward to returning to [the] set of 'Euphoria' next week," he said, demonstrating his commitment to the project.

Moreover, in a personal turn of events, Dane's marriage to Rebecca Gayheart has had its ups and downs. The couple, who share two daughters, faced a potential divorce in 2018, but remarkably reconciled in March 2025. As Dane juggles these challenges, he has requested privacy for himself and his family, emphasizing the need for space during this difficult time.

As Dane prepares to face the next chapter of his life and career, fans and colleagues are rallying behind him, showcasing the power of community support in times of adversity.

Write a short, informative, and quantitative news story on 'boca raton plane crash' with a bolded title that does not contain quotation marks nor slashes and multiple twists and turns by summarizing this article: CNN —

The Federal Aviation Administration and National Transporation Safety Board will investigate a small plane that crashed along a busy street and erupted into a fireball just outside the Boca Raton, Florida, airport Friday morning.

Three people who were onboard the twin-engine Cessna 310 when it crashed were killed, according to Michael LaSalle, assistant fire chief with Boca Raton Fire Rescue.

A man who was driving a car in the area was also injured after hitting a tree due to debris and fire from the crash. He suffered non-life threatening injuries and was taken to a local hospital, LaSalle said.

“We are deeply saddened to confirm that a plane crash occurred earlier today within our community,” Boca Raton Mayor Scott Singer said in a statement. “Our thoughts are with all those affected by this tragic event. We ask for patience and respect for the families involved as investigations continue.”

The plane took off from Boca Raton about 10 a.m. and was headed to Tallahassee, officials said. About 10:12 a.m. Boca Raton fire and police dispatch received a call for a plane in trouble and the aircraft crashed at 10:20 a.m., according to LaSalle and the FAA. The aircraft apparently had “some mechanical issues,” the assistant fire chief said.

Data from FlightRadar24 shows the aircraft made repeated loops around the airport before the crash.

“I heard it like zooming by a couple of times and then whew - a plane crashed,” one witness said on video posted to social media.

“The whole building shook,” another man noted.

CNN’s David Goodman contributed to this report.

Correction: An earlier version of this story misstated the time when the plane departed the Boca Raton airport. It took off at 10 a.m.

**Fatal Plane Crash in Boca Raton Under Investigation by Authorities**

A tragic plane crash occurred on Friday morning just outside Boca Raton, Florida, involving a twin-engine Cessna 310 that took off from Boca Raton Airport around 10 a.m. and was en route to Tallahassee. The aircraft experienced mechanical issues and ultimately crashed at approximately 10:20 a.m., creating a fireball that ignited debris along a busy street. The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) have initiated an investigation into the incident.

Unfortunately, all three individuals aboard the Cessna were killed, confirmed Michael LaSalle, assistant fire chief with Boca Raton Fire Rescue. In a concerning twist, a nearby motorist sustained non-life-threatening injuries after colliding with a tree as a result of the crash’s debris and fire. The injured driver was promptly transported to a local hospital for treatment.

Boca Raton Mayor Scott Singer expressed his condolences, stating, “We are deeply saddened to confirm that a plane crash occurred earlier today within our community. Our thoughts are with all those affected by this tragic event.” This sentiment resonates throughout the community as officials and residents alike process the shock of this occurrence.

Witnesses reported the aircraft making repeated loops around the airport prior to the crash, with one individual recalling, “I heard it like zooming by a couple of times and then whew - a plane crashed.” Another bystander added, “The whole building shook,” highlighting the crash's significant impact.

As the investigations by the FAA and NTSB unfold, authorities will work to uncover further details about the mechanical issues that led to this devastating event. The community continues to rally around the victims and their families during this tragic time.
